title: UNICAN - grupo COMECA
description: A website was developed for a medicinal plant trading company in Costa Rica. Additionally, a database and its respective server were developed to add or remove products. The website has several pages, its own domain and links to all the company's social networks, as well as being hosted on AWS

title: Plantas medicionales
description: A website was developed for a Costa Rican medicinal plant trading company. The website has several pages, its own domain and links to all the company's social networks.

title: Burger builder
description: A page with dynamic content was built that allows the user to choose ingredients and view the resulting burger. In addition, the page is responsive and uses form with field validation. The generated orders are stored in 'Firebase Realtime Database'

title: YaNoMas
description: Mobile application created for a Hackathon, consists of a system to report and prevent crimes locally. It used NoSQL databases and real-time geolocation.

title: MercaditoXTEC
description: Website and mobile application, aimed at students to facilitate the purchase and sale of products. We worked directly with an external client. The project focused on the use of requirement specification tools such as MockUps, usability tests, software architecture, among others.

title: Pizza App
description: Prototype app to manage pizza hut motorcycles. The application was made as a proof of concept for a posobile logistics solution. In addition, this project served to implement an application developed in Flutter using the Dart programming language, this allows applications for andriod and iOS to be generated using the same code base.

title: Linear Regression
description: Implement linear regression with one variable to predict profits for a food truck. Suppose that the CEO of a restaurant franchise is are considering different cities for opening a new outlet. The chain already has trucks in various cities and he has data for profits and populations from the cities.

title: Logistic Regression
description: This project consisted in building a logistic regression model to predict whether a student gets admitted into a university. Suppose that the administrator of a university department want to determine each applicant’s chance of admission based on their results on two exams. He has historical data from previous applicants that he can use as a training set for logistic regression. For each training example, he has the applicant’s scores on two exams and the admissions decision. The task is to build a classification model that estimates an applicant’s probability of admission based the scores from those two exams.

title: Logistic regression and neural networks
description: In this program, it were used logistic regression and neural networks to recognize handwritten digits (from 0 to 9). Automated handwritten digit recognition is widely used today - from recognizing zip codes (postal codes) on mail envelopes to recognizing amounts written on bank checks. This exercise will show how the methods learned can be used for this classification task.

title: Neural networks backpropagation algorithm
description: This project implemented feedforward propagation for neural networks and used it to predict handwritten digits with the weights we provided. Also implemented the backpropagation algorithm to learn the parameters for the neural network

title: Regularized linear regression and bias/variance trade
description: In the first half of this project, It will be implemented regularized linear regression to predict the amount of water flowing out of a dam using the change of water level in a reservoir. In the next half, It will go through some diagnostics of debugging learning algorithms and examine the effects of bias v.s. variance.

title: Support vector machines (SVMs)
description: In the first half of this project, It will be using support vector machines (SVMs) with various example 2D datasets. Experimenting with these datasets will help to gain an intuition of how SVMs work and how to use a Gaussian kernel with SVMs. In the next half of the exercise, It will be using support vector machines to build a spam classifier.

title: K-means algorithm
description: In this this project, It will be implemented the K-means algorithm and use it for image compression. Dirst start on an example 2D dataset that will help to gain an intuition of how the K-means algorithm works. After that, It will be used the K-means algorithm for image compression by reducing the number of colors that occur in an image to only those that are most common in that image

title: Anomaly detection algorithm
description: In this project, it will be implemented an anomaly detection algorithm to detect anomalous behavior in server computers. The features measure the through put (mb/s) and latency (ms) of response of each server. While the servers were operating, it was collected m = 307 examples of how they were behaving, and thus have an unlabeled dataset {x (1), . . . , x(m)}. It is suspected that the vast majority of these examples are “normal” (non-anomalous) examples of the servers operating normally, but there might also be some examples of servers acting anomalously within this dataset. It will use a Gaussian model to detect anomalous examples in your dataset. It will first start on a 2D dataset that will allow it to visualize what the algorithm is doing. On that dataset it will fit a Gaussian dis tribution and then find values that have very low probability and hence can be considered anomalies. After that, it will apply the anomaly detection algorithm to a larger dataset with many dimensions.

title: Arithmetic Formatter
description: Students in primary school often arrange arithmetic problems vertically to make them easier to solve. This project creates a function that receives a list of strings that are arithmetic problems and returns the problems arranged vertically and side-by-side. The function should optionally take a second argument. When the second argument is set to True, the answers should be displayed

title: Time Calculator
description: In this project, it is built a program to inteperpret and output multiple time formats. If the result will be the next day, it should show (next day) after the time. If the result will be more than one day later, it should show (n days later) after the time, where n is the number of days later

title: Budget App
description: this project should be able to instantiate objects based on different budget categories like food, clothing, and entertainment. When objects are created, they are passed in the name of the category. The class should have an instance variable called ledger that is a list

title: Polygon Area Calculator
description: In this project it will be used object oriented programming to create a Rectangle class and a Square class. The Square class should be a subclass of Rectangle and inherit methods and attributes.

title: Probability Calculator
description: Suppose there is a hat containing 5 blue balls, 4 red balls, and 2 green balls. What is the probability that a random draw of 4 balls will contain at least 1 red ball and 2 green balls? While it would be possible to calculate the probability using advanced mathematics, an easier way is to write a program to perform a large number of experiments to estimate an approximate probability.

title: Mean-Variance-Standard Deviation Calculator
description: A function named calculate() in mean_var_std.py that uses Numpy to output the mean, variance, standard deviation, max, min, and sum of the rows, columns, and elements in a 3 x 3 matrix. The input of the function should be a list containing 9 digits. The function should convert the list into a 3 x 3 Numpy array, and then return a dictionary containing the mean, variance, standard deviation, max, min, and sum along both axes and for the flattened matrix.

title: Demographic Data Analyzer
description: In this project It was analyzed demographic data using Pandas. It was given a dataset of demographic data that was extracted from the 1994 Census database

title: Medical Data Visualizer
description: In this project, it will be visualized and make calculations from medical examination data using matplotlib, seaborn, and pandas. The dataset values were collected during medical examinations.

title: Page View Time Series Visualizer
description: For this project It will be visualized a time series data using a line chart, bar chart, and box plots. It uses Pandas, Matplotlib, and Seaborn to visualize a dataset containing the number of page views each day on the freeCodeCamp.org forum from 2016-05-09 to 2019-12-03. The data visualizations will help to understand the patterns in visits and identify yearly and monthly growth.

title: Sea Level Predictor
description: In this project, I anaylized a dataset of the global average sea level change since 1880. I used the data to predict the sea level change through year 2050.
